alert.note: Alert for Chickasaw; Floyd; Howard; Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 12 at 10:30PM CDT until April 12 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: The National Weather Service in La Crosse has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Mitchell County in north central Iowa... Howard County in northeastern Iowa... Floyd County in north central Iowa... Western Chickasaw County in northeastern Iowa... Southern Olmsted County in southeastern Minnesota... Mower County in southeastern Minnesota... Western Fillmore County in southeastern Minnesota... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 1030 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ellendale to near Rockwell, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Rockford around 1045 PM CDT. Marble Rock around 1050 PM CDT. Nashua around 1115 PM CDT. Stewartville and Ionia around 1120 PM CDT. New Hampton around 1130 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Forestville State Park, Toeterville, Bradford, Chickasaw, County Roads T 54 And A 31, Fillmore and Mayville. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 175 and 206. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central and northeastern Iowa...and southeastern Minnesota. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central and northeastern Iowa...and southeastern Minnesota.
